item.title: Windows 10 Automatic Updates Start Causing Problems
item.description: Microsoft's controversial update policy has its first victims.
item.dc:creator: Gordon Kelly, Contributor
item.content:encoded: Microsoft's controversial update policy has its first victims.

item.title: Gamers Should Be Worried About Windows 10 Automatic Updates
item.description: Windows 10 has automatic updates that can't be stopped, leading to problems that could impact gamers with high-end graphics cards.
item.dc:creator: Erik Kain, Contributor
item.content:encoded: Windows 10 has automatic updates that can't be stopped, leading to problems that could impact gamers with high-end graphics cards.

item.title: The Xbox One/PS4 Console War Officially Enters A Giant New Territory
item.description: image source: Wikipedia China has officially lifted the 15-year nationwide ban on video game consoles, opening the doors for Sony, Microsoft and Nintendo to start selling the PS4, Xbox One and Wii U to the most populous nation on Earth. The Wall Street Journal reported the news first. China had been experimenting [...]

item.title: A 'Digital Quotient' To Better Measure Good Corporate Governance?
item.description: Companies have lofty ambitions: they expect digital initiatives to deliver annual growth and cost efficiencies of 5% to 10% or more in the next three to five years, suggests research. But when it comes to their digital maturity, it's a slightly different story. Mckinsey research on business expectation has been followed [...]

item.title: Video Game Characters Get 'Real' Bodies; They Still Look Great
item.description: Anything is possible in the fantasy world of video games. So why is it so hard to imagine Lara Croft with a muffin top or Cortana with thick thighs? Even as video games have increasingly realistic graphics, the way they depict the female body is anything but average. Now Bulimia.com, an eating [...]

item.title: Lyft Makes Starbucks An Offer It Couldn't Refuse
item.description: There has been one nut Starbucks couldn't crack: how to get its employees to work when they didn't have access to good public transportation.
item.dc:creator: Erika Morphy, Contributor
item.content:encoded: There has been one nut Starbucks couldn't crack: how to get its employees to work when they didn't have access to good public transportation.

item.title: Where Do Foreign Students Face The Highest University Fees? [Infographic]
item.description: Studying abroad can prove extremely expensive. Tuition fees vary widely across international universities, as do cost of living expenses. According to HSBC, the United States has the highest average annual fees for international students of any country worldwide – $24,914. Australia isn’t too far behind, with its annual university fees [...]
item.dc:creator: Niall McCarthy, Contributor
item.content:encoded: Studying abroad can prove extremely expensive. Tuition fees vary widely across international universities, as do cost of living expenses. According to HSBC, the United States has the highest average annual fees for international students of any country worldwide – $24,914. Australia isn’t too far behind, with its annual university fees [...]

item.title: How The Small State Of Israel Is Becoming A High-Tech Superpower
item.description: The horrific Iran nuclear deal is, these days, overshadowing the miracle of the Israeli economy, particularly in the area of high technology. With the exception of the U.S., Israel--a country of a mere 8 million people--leads the world in high tech, an astonishing feat. In this interview Prime Minister Benjamin [...]

item.title: Taking Control Of Your Personal Brand
item.description: Embrace your story. And make sure you’re the primary force in telling that story to the rest of the world. Some people go too far in trying to keep their privacy and their reputation from being damaged in cyberspace. They may shrink their digital presence by minimizing their social-media use or [...]

item.title: New iPhone 6S Photos Confirm Apple's Design Decision
item.description: Our first look at the front of the new iPhone 6S straight off the production line...
item.dc:creator: Gordon Kelly, Contributor
item.content:encoded: Our first look at the front of the new iPhone 6S straight off the production line...

item.title: Frustration And Anger As Apple's Reputation Tumbles
item.description: It has been hard to enjoy Apple's recent releases over the last few months. Updates for iOS appear to be arriving monthly to introduce more bugs than are fixed, OSX is focusing more on eye candy and cloud integration rather than a stable working environment, and Apple's online services are more focused on making money than providing better user experiences. The shine is coming off Apple.
item.dc:creator: Ewan Spence, Contributor
item.content:encoded: It has been hard to enjoy Apple's recent releases over the last few months. Updates for iOS appear to be arriving monthly to introduce more bugs than are fixed, OSX is focusing more on eye candy and cloud integration rather than a stable working environment, and Apple's online services are more focused on making money than providing better user experiences. The shine is coming off Apple.
